## 판결문 요약

487 F.3d 539
    UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee,v.Jeremy D. HAGENOW, Defendant-Appellant.
    No. 05-4443.
    United States Court of Appeals, Seventh Circuit.
    Argued February 13, 2007.
    Decided June 7, 2007.
    
      John M. Maciejczyk (argued), Office of the United States Attorney, South Bend, IN, Daniel L. Bella, Office of the United States Attorney, Hammond, IN, for Plaintiff-Appellee.
      Shaundra L. Kellam (argued), Office of the Federal Public Defender, Springfield, IL, Richard H. Parsons, Office of the Federal Public Defender, Peoria, IL, for Defendant-Appellant.
      Before CUDAHY, POSNER, and WILLIAMS, Circuit Judges.
      WILLIAMS, Circuit Judge.
    
    
      1
      In this appeal, we consider for the second time Jeremy Hagenow's sentence for his conviction of being a felon in possession of a firearm and ammunition. At the initial sentencing hearing, the government introduced an affidavit attached to an information to demonstrate that Hagenow's prior conviction for criminal confinement was for a "crime of violence" within the meaning of the sentencing enhancement provided in U.S.S.G. § 2K2.1. Subsequent case law made clear that such an affidavit was not an acceptable way of showing that a conviction constituted a crime of violence. At the sentencing hearing on remand, the government introduced instead the plea colloquy transcript from Hagenow's criminal confinement matter.
